SERMON DETAILS

Date:    2022-09-06
Title:   Cometh The Hour, Cometh The Man | Apostle Edgar H. Roscoe
Speaker: Edgar Roscoe
Church:  EL Tabernacle Ministries
Type:    Full Sermon
Language:English
URL:     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q9Pru1g-wG4
========================================

Description:
Preached on: Sunday, 09/06/2022

As you can see... 22 years ago it was said 
about Splitting of a Church. 

And now you can see that 
it has come to reality, that if you split 
a church you can’t make it for heaven.



"Cometh the Hour,  Cometh the Man..."

https://storehouse.eltabernacle.co.za/#/
Download our app and Subscribe Today to the ONLY App that cares about your soul.

by Apostle Edgar Hill Roscoe

Renovation work on Egypt’s infamous Menkaure Pyramid at Giza has commenced. Dubbed by the head of Egypt’s Supreme Council of Antiquities as “the project of the century,” the ongoing renovation aims to restore the pyramid’s original style by reconstructing the granite layer. Initially, the pyramid was encased in granite and lost part of its covering over time.

This comes at a time when Apostle Edgar Hill Roscoe is preaching on the Pyramid.

Follow the link for access to the full sermon: https://storehouse.eltabernacle.co.za/#/

SERMON DETAILS
========================================
Date:    2025-08-29
Title:   🌸 Bloom Where You Are Planted | Special Ladies Edition 🌸 
Speaker: William M. Branham
Church:  EL Tabernacle Ministries
Type:    Tape Service
Language:English
URL:     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nj31tDn252E
========================================

Description:
We are excited to announce the release of a very special book, “Bloom Where You Are Planted,” created exclusively for the ladies. 💐✨

This book is filled with wisdom, encouragement, and answers to many of the questions that women face today. Featuring insights and counsel from the Prophet William Branham, along with many other uplifting topics, it is designed to inspire every sister to grow and flourish exactly where God has placed her.

Whether it’s in your home, your church, or your community, this book will encourage you to bloom beautifully in God’s perfect plan. 🌷

📖 Bloom Where You Are Planted, a treasure for every sister’s heart.
TRANSCRIPT
========================================
Where flowers bloom, so do hope. Good evening, saints, and special greetings to all the beautiful ladies of our tabernacle. We recently celebrated our woman's day in Christ Jesus. The team bloom where you are planted was featured. The atmosphere was electrifying and uplifting. What a blessed and amazing day we had. to tell you all nothing was outsourced. Our speakers, our caterers, our floristers, our decor ladies, everything proudly L tabernacle and we have received positive feedbacks from the sisters who attended. But now we have an an important announcement. With the woman month, women's month closing up, the apostle has thought it wise and requested that the book titled Just for the Ladies by Brother Brennan be made available to the L Tabernacle ladies. We want to share a few insights and on how this book can be a blessing to you to each one of you. And we have our dear loving sister Abigail here with us to elaborate on a few questions. Thank you for joining us sister Abigail. You're welcome sister. >> Sister Abigail um what are some of the insights as to how this book can help the sisters and what is the what is it that the apostle would like the sister to take from this book? >> Good evening everybody. Um, I think I need to start off with to say where this book originated from. Sister Rosco had a copy of this book and somehow it just got missing and God purposed it so that sister Joanie found a copy of the same book in the US and she gave it to us a couple of years ago. So when the seminar came up and um I saw the answers that the apostle gave it just pointed back to the book. So the apostle has twigged it a bit and we would like every sister to have a copy of it. So the book is based on questions that our precious uh prophet was asked and how he answered them. But it's targeted mainly to the ladies, the sisters. And it is in line with our doctrine, our belief, with many um scriptures added to the questions and the answers. And then the apostle what he wants us to take out of the book is the there's a lot of questions that the uh prophet answers by saying uh he doesn't have scripture to prove what he is saying but you need to make sure that your um your objective and your motives are right in anything you do as a Christian. So that's the main focus the apostle wants us to take because so many of the questions we receive the apostle doesn't really have scriptures for it but it is a matter of staying away from sin then coming closer to sin. So that's the main objective and then I think it is for us to bloom where we are planted. Beautiful. We're looking forward to it. Um just another question instead. Um what are some of the nuggets in the book that the ladies can look forward to to reading? Well, not to give a lot away. I think the book covers a lot covers how to be a good wife, a good mom. It covers a lot on dress code. It even covers on having unbelieving husbands. So I think there is so much nuggets for each one. It depends what applies to your life. So it applies for young and old and I think I will keep my nuggets to myself for you to enjoy your nuggets out of the book. So does that mean because I wanted to ask you on a personal note, what are the key concepts you personally enjoyed in this book? >> Well, for me I enjoyed the ending and the beginning of the book. the ending because um it speaks about menopause and that's what I'm going through now Mles unfortunately and I enjoyed the testimony that Rebecca Brandon gave that what her mom went through and I'd never known about that. I've read a lot of uh brother Brandon speaking on Wright's uh sister that was going through menopause. So to me that had a bit of a personal impact and I didn't realize that so many sisters went through the prayer line where the prophet prayed for them and I think the the nice part that Rebecca says her dad told her that her mom will be better off after this. So I'm looking forward to that part of being better off. And then I think it's the beginning of the book where they have a nice quotation where the prophet speaks about his wife and just to see how kind and gentle and loving the prophet was towards his wife. And he even says she's getting old now. But I love her the way I loved her back then. So that was remarkable for me because the prophet is always seen as somebody that was illuminated and to see the soft part when it comes to the sisters was remarkable. It just shows me how the apostle feels about us that he has a soft part when it comes to the sisters and how they get treated. So I think it's a good read and a mustave because everybody will be able to get something out of it. Oh, amen. Thank you so much, Sister Abby. As you all heard, this is a must readad and we want to thank you for your input and insight into the groups. There we have it, ladies. We really do appreciate our apostle, the leadership, the love they have for us and the care. Sisters, with all the wisdom that has been shared and will be shared by reading this book, don't miss out. Go and grab your copy. I think it will be a available at the combine titled just for the ladies. Be sure to get one. Thank you so much. God bless you. See you in the library. >> Bye >> bye.

################################################################################
START OF FILE: 2022-10-08 - Climate Change  Apostle Edgar H. Roscoe - Edgar Roscoe.txt
################################################################################

SERMON DETAILS
========================================
Date:    2022-10-08
Title:   Climate Change | Apostle Edgar H. Roscoe
Speaker: Edgar Roscoe
Church:  EL Tabernacle Ministries
Type:    Full Sermon
Language:English
URL:     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wJIRhsw7mHQ
========================================

Description:
Watch the full sermon and much more exclusive content as preached by Apostle Edgar Hill Roscoe and all the Pastors and Ministers of EL Tabernacle Holy Ghost Ministry.

Subscribe Today and gain access to the world’s best content: https://storehouse.eltabernacle.co.za/
TRANSCRIPT
========================================
climate change from the two scriptures climate change the world is falling apart the world is falling apart that means that there is without a shed of a doubt that the world is going to have a traumatic climate change which they have never seen before we want to always know what is in the future what is there to follow covered 19. it is unequivocal that human activities are responsible for climate change that's the finding of a new study by the un's intergovernmental panel on climate change it's the most up-to-date assessment of how global warming will change the world in the coming decades environmental experts have called it a massive wake-up call to governments to cut emissions 234 authors from 66 countries have worked on the landmark assessment the report says global average temperature rise could reach or exceed 1.5 degrees Celsius in the next 20 years now that is 10 years sooner than expected that temperature rise will breach the ambition of the 2015 Paris climate agreement and bring widespread Devastation and unprecedented extreme weather this all comes less than three months before the cop 26 climate conference in Glasgow in Scotland vital un talks that will determine the future course of efforts to tackle climate change and the UK Minister responsible for delivering cop 26 has released this statement following the publication of today's report he says our message to every country government business and part of society is simple the next decade is decisive follow the science and embrace your responsibility to keep the goal of 1.5 degrees Celsius alive our environment and energy analyst Roger harobin has more wildfires blazing through Greece and Turkey have horrified people in the region the panel concludes we'll see a lot more fires as temperatures continue to rise and Rise they will as greenhouse gas emissions keep growing and growing The increased heat will change weather patterns bringing more droughts and more rainfall researchers say London was shocked to find areas underwater a few weeks ago rainfall patterns are hard to predict but experts say northern Europe will be wetter overall at London's Hampstead ponds they've already had to raise and reinforce the dams to protect hundreds of homes Downstream from the sort of floods expected in extreme rains that are forecast to come the cost has been huge we're already paying the price of ignoring scientists warnings on climate change so this report States as an absolute fact that human influence is warming the climate and that's a very Stark reminder that it is our activities which are changing the climate and affecting these extreme weather events um and as the planet continues to warm these consequences just get worse ice in the Arctic is melting faster than many scientists predicted that leads to sea level rise which in turn increases coastal flooding the Seas will keep Rising for maybe thousands of years because the ocean deep has absorbed so much heat already political attitudes are changing the UK is getting electric cars we need clean technology for home heating too in the words of one leading scientist we're not doomed but if we want to avoid catastrophe we have to drastically cut emissions now Roger harobin BBC News Valerie Masson delmot is a climate scientist and co-chair of one of the ipcc working groups which produce the Climate Change Report she said the threshold of keeping the global temperature at 1.5 degrees Celsius limit will be breached around 2050. the report shows that in the next 20 years global warming the average temperature at the Earth's surface over a period of 20 euros is expected to reach or exceed 1.5 degrees Celsius above the late 1800s however if we rapidly reduce greenhouse gas emissions if we can reach global net zero CO2 emissions around 2050. it is extremely likely that we can keep global warming well below 2 degrees if we do this it is more likely than not that temperature would gradually decline to below or around 1.5 degrees Celsius by the end of the century with a temporary overshoot of no more than 0.1 degrees Celsius but if Global greenhouse gas emissions remain around today's levels in the coming decades we would reach two degrees of global warming by the middle of this century we joined Now by Tamsin Edwards a climate scientist and one of the authors of this report welcome to BBC News I know your area of expertise is the oceans and sea level change and in fact you spent three years investigating this haven't haven't you so it would be remiss of me not to um find out more about that what did you find exactly well that's right we have over 200 authors um in the whole report we have uh looked at 14 000 scientific studies over three years and I work on ice sheets and sea level rise as you say we don't do new research we assess the robustness of the evidence so for example for the Antarctic ice sheet we looked at the range of possibilities of the future of the ice sheet and therefore its contribution to sea level rise and one of your findings is that the melting of Greenland glaciers is irreversible am I right well that's right so there are different parts of um there are different uh Ice uh regions around the world we have the glaciers of the mountains and the polar regions and we have the great ice sheets of Greenland and Antarctica the mountain and polar glasses are particularly sensitive and we have already committed to further melting over the next decades to hundreds of years we're also going to see more ice loss from the Greenland ice sheet over the next Century over this century and for the Antarctic ice sheet there's a really wide range of possibilities if we limit greenhouse gas emissions we may be fortunate and have a relatively low contribution to sea level rise but if we have very high greenhouse gas emissions and we're unlucky with how sensitive that ice sheet is we could see very high sea level rise indeed so at my right that the message is there's no going back from some change once they've melted they can't be refrozen I assume but there is a core optimism that this could be slowed or indeed even halted or is that putting it too optimistically we think that the the mountain and polar the mountain and polar Glaciers are these smaller glaciers and also Arctic sea ice um could have some reversible changes so if we limit warming and eventually reduce uh temperatures further that those could regrow and restore to some degree the ice sheets are much slower to respond so Greenland and Antarctica will keep responding for hundreds if not thousands of years and combined with the warming of the ocean which makes it expand and contribute to sea level rise that means sea levels are going to remain elevated for thousands of years I was very struck by what Inga Anderson said the executive director of the UN environment program she said scientists have been telling us for over three decades of the dangers of allowing the planet to warm the world listened but did not hear and I wondered do you think government and people will it's a difference isn't it between taking any notice of this and doing something about it of course I mean speaking personally you know I I do sense a real shift in the in the conversation over the last few years but I think what this um ipcc assessment
